fullText: Jez Butterworth's new play is a sprawling family drama that moves between 1976 and the present, examining the dreams and disappointments of the Webb family through the lens of their shared obsession with The Mamas & The Papas.
dtliExcerpt: Jez Butterworth's new play is a sprawling family drama that moves between 1976 and the present, examining the dreams and disappointments of the Webb family through the lens of their shared obsession with The Mamas & The Papas.
showScoreExcerpt: Jez Butterworth's new play is a sprawling family drama that moves between 1976 and the present, examining the dreams and disappointments of the Webb family through the lens of their shared obsession with The Mamas & The Papas.
nycTheatreExcerpt: You can tell that 10 of the actors (including the four adult sisters and their younger counterparts) have been doing the play for six months already, and their performances are now detailed and lived-in. They're aided by Howell's costumes (which perfectly establish period and social status), chilling lighting from Natasha Chivers, and positively ghostly sound design by Nick Powell.
